item.description:

item.title: $OKB Jumps Over 6% After 65M Token Burn and ‘X Layer’ Launch
item.description:
$OKB has climbed on a token burn, a 21M cap, and X Layer’s launch as a gas token. Price has consolidated above $120–$122 and traded near $123 after meeting $130 resistance. OKX has begun OKTChain conversions, while on-chain data has shown ~17,900 holders and high address concentration.

 

The post $OKB Jumps Over 6% After 65M Token Burn and ‘X Layer’ Launch appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Is Bitcoin’s Dip the Calm Before Uptober? Bitcoin Hyper May Be the Catalyst for Q4 Gains
item.description:
Bitcoin Hyper has integrated the Solana Virtual Machine into Bitcoin’s base layer, extending BTC utility beyond its store-of-value role. With $10.6M in presale backing, the Layer-2 project has gained attention as traders look toward a Fed rate cut, September volatility, and Uptober’s bullish history.

The post Is Bitcoin’s Dip the Calm Before Uptober? Bitcoin Hyper May Be the Catalyst for Q4 Gains appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: China’s DeepSeek AI Predicts The Price of XRP, XLM, and DOGE This August
item.description:
DeepSeek Predicts XRP, Monero, and Dogecoin could rise before August closes, even as Bitcoin faces turbulence after inflation data and regulatory shifts. U.S. policy updates, including the GENIUS Act and SEC reforms, have shaped fresh optimism for a crypto breakout.

item.title: Wall Street Pepe Expands Into Solana – WEPE Seeks to Be the Alpha of the Meme Coin Epicenter
item.description:
Wall Street Pepe has expanded to Solana, establishing a dual-chain economy with Ethereum through a burn-and-mint model. The move enables faster transactions, NFT integrations, and broader community tools, backed by Best Wallet support as the meme coin ecosystem builds momentum ahead of its NFT drop.

The post Wall Street Pepe Expands Into Solana – WEPE Seeks to Be the Alpha of the Meme Coin Epicenter appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: ChatGPT’s Bitcoin Analysis: BlackRock’s $548M Exit Tests $113K – Bounce or Breakdown?
item.description:
ChatGPT's Bitcoin Analysis has detailed BTC at $113,912 (-2.05%) amid sales by BlackRock and Ark 21Shares; price has slipped below the 20/50-day EMAs while holding above the 100/200-day levels, with MACD negative, RSI near 42 and thin volume suggesting a cautious tape.

The post ChatGPT’s Bitcoin Analysis: BlackRock’s $548M Exit Tests $113K – Bounce or Breakdown? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Chair Paul Atkins Praise The Genius Act As A ‘Seminal’ Step For Crypto
item.description:
Paul Atkins has praised the GENIUS Act at SALT Wyoming, calling Congress’s passage a “seminal” step toward crypto clarity. Treasury has sought public comment on illicit finance risks, Donald Trump has signed the law, and Scott Bessent has said stablecoins could expand dollar access.

The post Chair Paul Atkins Praise The Genius Act As A ‘Seminal’ Step For Crypto appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Bullish IPO Raises Record $1.15B With Solana Stablecoins – Is This Crypto’s Takeover?
item.description:
Bullish has raised $1.15B through a stablecoin-based IPO involving USDC, EURC, and others, largely settled on Solana. The development has highlighted rising adoption of Bullish Solana Stablecoins in regulated financial markets worldwide.

The post Bullish IPO Raises Record $1.15B With Solana Stablecoins – Is This Crypto’s Takeover? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Tether Hires Ex-White House Crypto Council Director Bo Hines as U.S. Strategy Advisor
item.description:
Tether has appointed Bo Hines, former White House Crypto Council executive director, as strategic advisor for U.S. digital assets strategy. The move reflects a wider industry trend of hiring ex-policymakers as Congress considers stablecoin legislation shaping the future of U.S. crypto oversight.

The post Tether Hires Ex-White House Crypto Council Director Bo Hines as U.S. Strategy Advisor appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.description:

item.title: Harvard Economist Who Predicted Bitcoin Crashing to $100 Admits He Was Wrong
item.description:
Harvard economist Kenneth Rogoff publicly admits his decade-old prediction that Bitcoin would crash to $100 was fundamentally flawed, acknowledging three critical miscalculations about U.S. crypto regulation, the $20 trillion underground economy, and massive government cryptocurrency holdings while Bitcoin trades above $115,000.

The post Harvard Economist Who Predicted Bitcoin Crashing to $100 Admits He Was Wrong appeared first on Cryptonews.
